section.name: JGGApi - Gadu-Gadu protocol implementation.
section.p: JGGApi is a Gadu-Gadu protocol implementation based on specification from EKG. Gadu-Gadu is a very famous Instant Messanger in Poland.

Thanks to the libary it is very easy to create applications that communicate with Gadu-Gadu server. It uses commonly used design patterns (GoF) that minimizie the learnining curve for developers that are going to contribute to this project. It has a good internal structure and realizes a paradigm of programming - programming by extension not by modification. What is more, it will help developers that are going to write applications similar to Kadu, Gaim or command-line EKG to fasten their development process.

section.name: Releases
section.p: There is an old version of the library that has already been released. It works fine but has limited functionality.

Currently, we are preparing for the new release of the library (1.0) that has many improvements and clearer design. It is not compatible with the old version, interfaces have changed significantly but porting from old version should not be a difficult task.

section.name: Features
section.p:
The upcoming version (1.0) will allow:
Sending and receiving messages.
Possibility to retrieve message delivery confirmation
Exporting and importing of the contact list.
Setting status and notification of user's changing status.
Notification of changing statuses.
Ability to read and write personal information to the public directory.
Possibility to search public directory based on user defined criteria.

ul.li: The current version is not thread safe but the thread safety check will be perfomed soon.

Initial status that is set in LoginContext does not work. At beginning we send Login60 packet but the Gadu-Gadu server is ignoring it. Therefore we have to sent status packet after connecting. What is more, it is known that this is also done by a standard Gadu-Gadu client, i.e. explicite setting status.
Write support for larger contact lists. Current implementation is limited to contact lists that are not more than 2040 bytes long.
Add ability to send larger notify lists, i.e. list that is send at the beginning to notify Gadu-Gadu server what users we want to monitor.
The libary is not tested enough therefore adding JUnit tests is of high importance.
